授業目的: 縄文時代から室町時代までの日本美術史を勉強し、美術作品の見方と説明の仕方を練習します。refer to the following.
到達目標: 日本美術の作品の分析と説明をより詳しくできるようになります。refer to the following.
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
【合併】総合日本学習科目（美術Ｂ）（CIEC）/Japanese Art B（国際学部）
関連科目: 総合日本学習科目（美術A）
授業方法: Synchronous face to face format. Lecture & Discussion/Student Presentations

第1回: Self Introductions. Class introduction. Ceramics and Crafts in the Jomon Period. (Reading: Jomon Culture, by the Department of Asian Art, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, October 2002. Listening: "The Magic of Japanese Masterpieces, Dogu with Goggles excavated in Kamegaoka site, Aomori prefecture (Shakoki Dogu)," by NHK World)
Reading assignment and research journal entry
第2回: Ceramics, Crafts, and Bronze Work in the Yayoi Period (Reading: Yayoi Culture, by the Department of Asian Art, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, October 2002. Listening: "The Magic of Japanese Masterpieces, Ritual Bell with Crossed Band Design (Dotaku)," by NHK World.)
Reading assignment and research journal entry
第3回: Ceramics, Tumuli, and Wall Paintings in the Kofun Period (Reading: Kofun Period, by the Department of Asian Art, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, October 2002). Listening: The Magic of Japanese Masterpieces, Haniwa (Terracotta Tomb Figurine), Warrior In Keiko Armor (Haniwa Keiko no Bujin)," by NHK World
Reading assignment and research journal entry
第4回: The Jomon, Yayoi, and Kofun Periods (cont.)
Reading assignment and research journal entry
第5回: Calligraphy, Sculpture, and Architecture in the Asuka & Nara Periods (Reading: Asuka & Nara Periods, by the Department of Asian Art, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, October 2002). The Magic of Japanese Masterpieces, Carved Wood Gigaku Mask of Konron (Gigaku Men Konron)," by NHK World
Reading assignment and research journal entry
第6回: Reading assignment and research journal entry
第7回: Kimono, Literature, and Painting in The Heian Period (Reading: Heian Period, by the Department of Asian Art, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, October 2002)
Reading assignment and research journal entry
第8回: Reading assignment and research journal entry
第9回: Sculpture and Painting in the Kamakura & Nanbokucho Periods (Reading 1: Kamakura & Nanbokucho Periods, by the Department of Asian Art, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, October 2002. Reading 2: Zen Buddhism, by the Department of Asian Art, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, October 2002)
Reading assignment and research journal entry
第11回: Calligraphy, Zen Buddhism, the Tea Ceremony, and Garden Design in the Muromachi Period (Reading: Muromachi Period, by the Department of Asian Art, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, October 2002)

Links to lectures, reading assignments, and other study materials will be provided online

Students will be required to complete reading, listening, and viewing assignments in preparation for our in-class discussions and the Comparative Analysis Presentation. Students will also be required to research art movements, artists, and individual works of art in preparation for discussions, and to create a journal of notes containing descriptions of art from the periods discussed in class.
